snippet: A former garbage dump in New Jersey is helping restore crew to the New York metropolitan area, providing ideal rowing conditions unaffected by tides and boat traffic.
abstract: Overpeck Creek, former garbage dump in New Jersey, has become a hotspot for rowing in the New York metropolitan area; rowers say the creek's conditions are ideal, since it is unaffected by tides and boat traffic. Photos (M)8
lead_paragraph: LEONIA, N.J. -- Near the junction of the New Jersey Turnpike and Interstate 80, not far from the conga line of traffic grinding toward New York City, lies a body of water that was once a garbage dump. It was a murky soup of reeking refuse, home to a flotilla of plastic bottles, tires and even refrigerators. The land around it was good for only two things, some longtime residents say, and that was illegal dumping and trapping muskrat.

headline.main: Once an Urban Landfill, Now a Rowing Paradise
